channel.title: iPod App
channel.description: I was wondering if any knew how to make and iPod app for an rsps? If so, pm me about it. Im willing to pay for services. Thanks!

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:30, topic:407889”]im meaning the page is longer than it needs to be. its fine dont get me wrong just it bothers me a little bit b/c u have 2 scroll bars the scroll bar for the entire page and then a scroll bar for the inner frame.

the reason the page is long b/c the side menu has an expanded section in it, if the side menu was dynamic and expanded and collapsed onmouseover then seems better to me idk about others opinions though. ok well after interacting with the page he has the idea i was talking about with onmouseclick but the page is longer than it needs to be the bottom of the page needs to be like +/-10 pixels below the side menu item “West Virginia Forestry” i think it would look nicer. idk like have the container.bottom = client.height; <-- not working code but something similar should be they only thing needed to fix this. anyway its just a suggestion. if u still dont understand i could download the page itself and try to implement what im trying to say.

edit: after playing with the page a little it will take a little more work then i thought. if all the content autosized, relative to the size of the container div, with a minimum size. it would work out nicely[/quote]Oh, you mean like RuneScape top bar? with the drop boxes? :o

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

im meaning the page is longer than it needs to be. its fine dont get me wrong just it bothers me a little bit b/c u have 2 scroll bars the scroll bar for the entire page and then a scroll bar for the inner frame.

the reason the page is long b/c the side menu has an expanded section in it, if the side menu was dynamic and expanded and collapsed onmouseover then seems better to me idk about others opinions though. ok well after interacting with the page he has the idea i was talking about with onmouseclick but the page is longer than it needs to be the bottom of the page needs to be like +/-10 pixels below the side menu item “West Virginia Forestry” i think it would look nicer. idk like have the container.bottom = client.height; <-- not working code but something similar should be they only thing needed to fix this. anyway its just a suggestion. if u still dont understand i could download the page itself and try to implement what im trying to say.

edit: after playing with the page a little it will take a little more work then i thought. if all the content autosized, relative to the size of the container div, with a minimum size. it would work out nicely

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:27, topic:407889”]u will have youtube. youtube does webm videos which safari should have. u can do things in html5 that ppl use flash for. idk, i havent read it anywhere but windows and adobe probably will work together or whatever. ik when u go to get flash while in ie9 they tell u about getting the beta version of flash, but when i went to check in chrome they are like chrome already has flash it will update when there is a new release or whatever. thats what makes me think about microsoft and adobe my kinda team up with each other. idk like i said i havent read anything about it.

about that website even though im not the best with website design, why does it have a box that scrolls inside a page that scrolls? maybe suggest that the side menu is shortened and expands on hover so the whole page doesnt scroll only the inner frame does. it just seems a little weird to me. im sure ur grandfather is good its just some constructive criticism.[/quote]I don’t know what you mean by “the side menu is shortened and expands on hover so the whole page doesnt scroll only the inner frame does”. But OK

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @saadmboy saadmboy
item.description:
@saadmboy wrote:

Mr.czar:

Doesn’t Android run the same revision as ipod? 2.2?

Lol no…android is a whole different operating system…ios = apple (ipod, ipad, iphone) and android = android.
@rune… I just told u that apple is kinda breaking its relationships with adobe and doesnt support adobe flash cs5 made apps…And yes HTML5 is wayyyy better then flash for reasons that include no downloading extra plugins, html5 is faster, easier to code and is better supported then flash (facebook, twitter all use it and the reason is many mobile phones support html5 and not flash (take iphone for example(it never supported flash even when apple liked adobe (which was for such a short period of time (now how many brackets do i have to close???)))))

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

u will have youtube. youtube does webm videos which safari should have. u can do things in html5 that ppl use flash for. idk, i havent read it anywhere but windows and adobe probably will work together or whatever. ik when u go to get flash while in ie9 they tell u about getting the beta version of flash, but when i went to check in chrome they are like chrome already has flash it will update when there is a new release or whatever. thats what makes me think about microsoft and adobe my kinda team up with each other. idk like i said i havent read anything about it.

about that website even though im not the best with website design, why does it have a box that scrolls inside a page that scrolls? maybe suggest that the side menu is shortened and expands on hover so the whole page doesnt scroll only the inner frame does. it just seems a little weird to me. im sure ur grandfather is good its just some constructive criticism.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

I just found this information out today.

Apple apparently isn’t going to support adobe on any of their devices anymore. That means no more YouTube or anything that runs with flash. This means war between Adobe and Apple. Apple actually used Photoshop when they made their graphics. And since HTML5 supports a lot of flash, Apple is basically cutting their throats. Also I heard when you download Apple products, it gets into files that have nothing to do with what they were made for.

I have gotten all this information from my Grandfather, and yes, he does know what he’s talking about. He codes the site for the West Virginia Highlands Conservancy.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @saadmboy saadmboy
item.description:
@saadmboy wrote:

^^^ whenever i troll moparscape forums im on my iphone so i kinda am lazy to post, go back find the username, post edit and do it again and agin for the three @ the persons… So i just remember the questions and reply to them in one post and 1 edit
I am not encouraging this but xcode can be downloaded from torrents also (im not sure if posting bout torrents is allowed or not so any mod feel free to delete this part). And as i said earlier u dont need the p12 certificate to publish apps from xcode so u can make (and publish and send apps to cydia) without having any apple account (wether its itunes or the dev acoount u dont need it)
Btw u need a mac/hackintosh for xcode (sorry thats the only way)

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“saadmboy, post:19, topic:407889”][quote author=xryz link=topic=509174.msg3701621#msg3701621 date=1312770392]
i got xcode for free, did they change it?
[/quote]
No xcode is free u have to pay to submit apps to the appstore (wheter if its a free app or paid one)
@ the person asking if u can make games: u can make anything (the only limit is ur imagination)
@ the person who said u have to give ur credit card to get an itunes account: u csn actually get it without givibg ur cc info (google how to do it)
@ the person who said use adobe flash:

  1. i tried making an app once and its a pain in the ass
  2. Apple does not support it anymore
  3. To publish the app (meaning to get the completed app in ipa format (iphone os format)) u need a paid($99 per month) dev account’s p12 certificate, wheras with xcode u dont need the certificate[/quote]@ the person = RuneWings317 BITCH! xD

And I know about the game, I said it was a derp question. And when I went to download the Xcode thing, it said I needed to get the big bundle shit thing… And I’m glad you told me about the adobe shit, cause now I don’t need to waist my time downloading.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @saadmboy saadmboy
item.description:
@saadmboy wrote:

xryz:

i got xcode for free, did they change it?

No xcode is free u have to pay to submit apps to the appstore (wheter if its a free app or paid one)
@ the person asking if u can make games: u can make anything (the only limit is ur imagination)
@ the person who said u have to give ur credit card to get an itunes account: u csn actually get it without givibg ur cc info (google how to do it)
@ the person who said use adobe flash:

  1. i tried making an app once and its a pain in the ass
  2. Apple does not support it anymore
  3. To publish the app (meaning to get the completed app in ipa format (iphone os format)) u need a paid($99 per month) dev account’s p12 certificate, wheras with xcode u dont need the certificate

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“runewings317, post:14, topic:407889”][quote author=saadmboy link=topic=509174.msg3698871#msg3698871 date=1312610182]
Actually you can make a game for ipod/iphone without the $99 apple dev account. Apple has a free dev program to where you can download xcode for free (which is needed to program for ios) however you can’t release it to the app store without having the paid dev account. But if you really wanna release your app release it in Cydia (only for jailbreakers)
I have xcode 4.1 and a free apple dev account
[/quote]Will this make games? <–Derp Question xD

Edit: If I would happen to release it on the App Store and my primary group is Free Applications, will I still be able to have some ingame stuff that they have to pay for? And I’m guessing when I sign up I don’t have to pay for it until I post on appstore right?[/quote]

You can try, but you need an apple account which requires a credit card at creation

Read full topic

But if you really wanna release your app release it in Cydia (only for jailbreakers)
I have xcode 4.1 and a free apple dev account[/quote]Will this make games? <–Derp Question xD

Edit: If I would happen to release it on the App Store and my primary group is Free Applications, will I still be able to have some ingame stuff that they have to pay for? And I’m guessing when I sign up I don’t have to pay for it until I post on appstore right?

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @saadmboy saadmboy
item.description:
@saadmboy wrote:

Actually you can make a game for ipod/iphone without the $99 apple dev account. Apple has a free dev program to where you can download xcode for free (which is needed to program for ios) however you can’t release it to the app store without having the paid dev account. But if you really wanna release your app release it in Cydia (only for jailbreakers)
I have xcode 4.1 and a free apple dev account

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

xryz:

i dont understand why u cant make an app that plays a rsps. yes you would have to write the client from scratch and it wouldnt be anything close graphic-wise to current rsps, but having 2d or 3d canvas(right now i cant think of the correct word), and just have it be able to communicate between the server with the correct packets. its a lot of work but theres not reason its not possible.

what a complete underestimation of the amount of work needed.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

xryz:

i dont understand why u cant make an app that plays a rsps. yes you would have to write the client from scratch and it wouldnt be anything close graphic-wise to current rsps, but having 2d or 3d canvas(right now i cant think of the correct word), and just have it be able to communicate between the server with the correct packets. its a lot of work but theres not reason its not possible.

Have fun porting the client to Objective-C.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:8, topic:407889”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=509174.msg3694491#msg3694491 date=1312338550]

Droid > iPhone/iPod

Could make an Android app for free, while of course Apple requires a massive fee to make anything that would make them even MORE money once on the App Store.

Small correction on that. Making an android app is free, yes. Just, to get listed in the market you need to pay a measly $25. Although, if you sell the app via internet, they can turn on a function within android that skips the license checking.
[/quote]You can distribute any .apk without paying anything. Maybe it takes $25 to post it on the Market, but you can disperse it through other means. (Though less popular.)

But my reasonings for Droid > iPhone/iPod go much beyond just the app-making elements.[/quote]
Again, I never said you had to pay to distribute.

@xryz - The idea itself is possible, but the likelihood of it happening or even someone understanding the packets enough to do so is slim. I can only think of 2 people personally who could.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod App
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:6, topic:407889”]Droid > iPhone/iPod

Could make an Android app for free, while of course Apple requires a massive fee to make anything that would make them even MORE money once on the App Store.[/quote]
Small correction on that. Making an android app is free, yes. Just, to get listed in the market you need to pay a measly $25. Although, if you sell the app via internet, they can turn on a function within android that skips the license checking.
